Programming tasks are problems that may be solved through programming.

The end goal is to demonstrate how the same task is accomplished in different languages.

links.title: FE-Schrift - Wikipedia
links.description: The FE-Schrift[1] or Fälschungserschwerende Schrift (forgery-impeding typeface) is a sans serif typeface introduced for use on licence plates. Its monospaced letters and numbers are slightly disproportionate to prevent easy modification and to improve machine readability. It has been developed in Germany where it has been mandatory since November 2000.[2]

links.title: Sukhoi Okhotnik - Wikipedia
links.description: The Sukhoi Okhotnik or Sukhoi S-70 "Okhotnik" (Russian: Сухой С-70 "Охотник", lit. 'Hunter'), also referred to as Okhotnik-B[3], is a Russian stealth heavy unmanned combat aerial vehicle (UCAV) being developed by Sukhoi as a sixth-generation aircraft project.[4] The drone is based on the earlier Mikoyan Skat, designed by MiG,[5] and encompassing some technologies of the fifth-generation Sukhoi Su-57 fighter jet.[6]

links.title: Palermo Technical Impact Hazard Scale - Wikipedia
links.description: The Palermo Technical Impact Hazard Scale is a logarithmic scale used by astronomers to rate the potential hazard of impact of a near-earth object (NEO). It combines two types of data—probability of impact and estimated kinetic yield—into a single "hazard" value. A rating of 0 means the hazard is equivalent to the background hazard (defined as the average risk posed by objects of the same size or larger over the years until the date of the potent...

links.title: Impact event - Wikipedia
links.description: An impact event is a  collision between astronomical objects causing measurable effects.[1] Impact events have physical consequences and have been found to regularly occur in planetary systems, though the most frequent involve asteroids, comets or meteoroids and have minimal effect. When large objects impact terrestrial planets such as the Earth, there can be significant physical and biospheric consequences, though atmospheres mitigate many surfa...

links.title: Asteroid impact avoidance - Wikipedia
links.description: Asteroid impact avoidance comprises a number of methods by which near-Earth objects (NEO) could be diverted, preventing destructive impact events.  A sufficiently large impact by an asteroid or other NEOs would cause, depending on its impact location, massive tsunamis, multiple firestorms and an impact winter caused by the sunlight-blocking effect of placing large quantities of pulverized rock dust, and other debris, into the stratosphere.

links.title: Topological sorting - Wikipedia
links.description: In computer science, a topological sort or topological ordering of a directed graph is a linear ordering of its vertices such that for every directed edge uv from vertex u to vertex v, u comes before v in the ordering. For instance, the vertices of the graph may represent tasks to be performed, and the edges may represent constraints that one task must be performed before another; in this application, a topological ordering is just a valid sequen...

links.title: Semantic primes - Wikipedia
links.description: Semantic primes or semantic primitives are a set of semantic concepts[1] that are innately understood but cannot be expressed in simpler terms. They represent words or phrases that are learned through practice but cannot be defined concretely. For example, although the meaning of "touching" is readily understood, a dictionary might define "touch" as "to make contact" and "contact" as "touching", providing no information if neither of these words ...
